#summary The <style> Tag

= Introduction =

The `<style>` tag contains supplemental style declarations for this sheet.


= Details =

Every Nerdcules character sheet may have one `<style>` tag. This is an optional tag. It must appear inside the [TagHead <head>] tag, and is seventh in sequence, appearing after the optional [TagDescription <description>] tag.

The `<style>` tag can contain any valid CSS. There are several standard elements and classes used by the Nerdcules parser that you may wish to override:

* element {{{form label}}} Used for text labels
* class {{{.column}}} Used for columns
* class (((.dot}}} Used for Nerdcules.Dots elements
* class {{{.spinner}}} Used for Nerdcules.Spinner elements
* class {{{.arrow}}} Used for the up- and down-arrows for Dots and Spinners

== Example ==

{{{
<sheet>
  <head>
    <style>
      place any valid CSS here
    </style>
  </head>
</sheet>
}}}
